channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 133-135 plumstead common road, 1st August
item.description:
Right next to the bus stop. One of the properties here has dumped several black bags (?!) Of garden waste on the public pavement. Obstruction and eye sore, spilling out and attracting further littering

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish spilled over pavement, 1st August
item.description:
Apparently the residents of 187-189 Plumstead common road have been told by the council to leave there flimsy black bin bags and rubbish on the pavement for collection. Well, they have been torn open leaving all sorts on the street. See photo with my child - this is my daily reality of living around Plumstead common. Can't even take them to the common anymore due to the amount of rubbish. It is disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 187, Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent littering &fly tipping near post office, 1st August
item.description:
From post office to the housing estate there is persistent littering and fly tipping. Outside post office people drop the cash machine receipts on the floor. There is are several bags of rubble on the pavement attracting rubbish. When I asked the post office proprietor he said they were his and he's not moving them. They are on a public footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-15, Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes taking over the pavement, 1st August
item.description:
A plethora of lime bikes parked all over the pavement outside the Methodist Church

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Terrace, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a large steel ladder next to my house behind the bushes, 1st August
item.description:
There is a large steel ladder next to my building. This is a little concerning, as I often leave the small windows on my second floor open. There is also a lot of other rubbish behind the bush and it seems to be have become a dumping ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-32, Palace Square, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge/Vegetation over hanging pavement., 1st August
item.description:
Hedge of 104 Croydon Road is growing over the payment and needs cutting. Brambles from rear of 102 Croydon Road over hanging pavement in Genoa Road. The same problem occurred in 2024.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Genoa Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots causing paving to rise and create trip hazard, 1st August
item.description:
The tree roots have pushed up the paving slabs and concrete outside number 28 Wren Road. It is really high and the slabs are rocking. If anyone tripped over it, they could break a bone it is that dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 25, 1st August
item.description:
This damage on the pavement appears to be related to the previous subsidence issue caused by tree roots. It’s been quite a while since the trees were removed, but the pavement has not yet been repaired. Could you please advise if there are plans to fix this area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lisburne Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At junction of Queens Crescent and Prince of Wales Road, 1st August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Crescent, Chalk Farm, London

item.title: Overgrown tree outside 102 imperial way, 1st August
item.description:
The overgrown branches have thorns and will soon cause harm to someone walking past

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Imperial Way, London

item.title: Fly tiping and rubbish all along herbert terrace, 1st August
item.description:
There is rubbish and fly tipping all along the bank between herbert road and herbert terrace. Needs a thorough clean up and cctv installed/signs Threatening fines. Fly tipping includes a set of drawers, a baby crib mattress and two chairs. So much litter. Disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture on pavement again, 1st August
item.description:
More furniture on the pavement outside 53 Balliol Road again, been there over 3 weeks now. This is becoming a regular occurrence, a letter needs to be sent to home owners, instead of my council tax paying for free collection!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balliol Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless Encampment, 1st August
item.description:
Large group of rowdy threatening individuals, sleeping, cooking and living on the square. Rubbish everywhere and frequently break out into verbal and physical fights. Utterly unpleasant for anyone else to use this park as it’s unsafe and you have to move through quickly and keep your wits about you. What are the council doing about this, it’s been going on for years?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cavendish Square, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard dumped, 1st August
item.description:
A large amount of card board boxes have been broken down along with big bags and dumped next to litter bin on Montagu Square and Upper Montagu Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Montagu Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet
